To achieve both the hover effect and center the tag both horizontally and vertically on a webpage, you can use the following CSS code: ```css /* CSS for the tag */ .tag { width: 200px; /* Set a specific width for the tag */ height: 100px; /* Set a specific height for the tag */ background-color: lightgray; /* Initial background color */ color: white; /* Initial text color */ text-align: center; /* Center text horizontally */ line-height: 100px; /* Center text vertically within the tag */ margin: 0 auto; /* Center horizontally */ display: flex; /* Enable flexbox for vertical centering */ align-items: center; /* Center content vertically */ justify-content: center; /* Center content horizontally */ transition: background-color 0.3s, color 0.3s; /* Smooth transition for hover effect */ } /* Hover effect */ .tag:hover { background-color: green; /* Change background color on hover */ color: black; /* Change text color on hover */ } /* Centering the tag within the webpage */ .body { display: flex; /* Enable flexbox for centering */ align-items: center; /* Center content vertically */ justify-content: center; /* Center content horizontally */ height: 100vh; /* Full height of the viewport */ margin: 0; /* Remove default margin */ } ``` To apply this CSS, use the following HTML structure: ```html Centered Tag with Hover Effect
Hover over me!
``` This code will create a tag that is centered both horizontally and vertically on the webpage. When you hover over the tag, its background color will change to green and the text color will change to black. The transition effect will make the color changes smooth.
